title: How to Make Chicken Spicy Garlic Pizza

steps.headline: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat.
Mix 1 cup of the flour, the yeast and the water.
Beat until smooth and sticky (2-3 minutes in mixer).
steps.description: This step helps to build gluten strands which contribute to a good rise and texture for the pizza crust.

steps.headline: Add salt, oil and whole wheat flour.
Slowly add the rest of the flour and knead until the dough is soft, satiny and pliable.
steps.description: The kneading process also builds gluten strands. It is difficult to knead the dough too much. Eight minutes is a good amount of kneading time.

steps.headline: Let the dough rest for ten minutes.
Place thawed chicken breast in the pan with hot oil.
steps.description: Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Cover the skillet and allow chicken to cook.
steps.description: Turn after ten minutes and continue to cook until meat thermometer registers 160 degrees.

steps.headline: Add the red peppers to the skillet when you turn the chicken.
Press dough onto a greased 16" pizza pan.
Mix sauce.
steps.description: Combine tomato sauce, garlic salsa, sugar and Italian seasoning.

steps.headline: Spread shredded spinach over the chicken.
Sprinkle cheese over the entire pizza.
Bake pizza in a hot oven for approximately 12 minutes.
steps.description: Crust will brown and cheese will be completely melted when the pizza is done.

text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat.  Mix 1 cup of the flour, the yeast and the water.  Beat until smooth and sticky (2-3 minutes in mixer). This step helps to build gluten strands which contribute to a good rise and texture for the pizza crust. Add salt, oil and whole wheat flour.  Mix until thoroughly combined.  Slowly add the rest of the flour and knead until the dough is soft, satiny and pliable. The kneading process also builds gluten strands. It is difficult to knead the dough too much. Eight minutes is a good amount of kneading time. Let the dough rest for ten minutes.  Place thawed chicken breast in the pan with hot oil. Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Cover the skillet and allow chicken to cook. Turn after ten minutes and continue to cook until meat thermometer registers 160 degrees. Add the red peppers to the skillet when you turn the chicken.  Press dough onto a greased 16" pizza pan.  Mix sauce. Combine tomato sauce, garlic salsa, sugar and Italian seasoning. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.  Spread sauce over crust.  Add chicken and peppers.  Spread shredded spinach over the chicken.  Sprinkle cheese over the entire pizza.  Bake pizza in a hot oven for approximately 12 minutes. Crust will brown and cheese will be completely melted when the pizza is done.
